benchmark_details.name: Bargaining task benchmark
benchmark_details.overview: This work formally formulated the Bargaining task for LLM agents and collected a dataset for the Bargaining task, AmazonHistoryPrice, based on Amazonâ€™s price history. This benchmark helps evaluate the bargaining abilities of various LLMs, focusing on the performance of buyers and sellers in different bargaining scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate large language models' bargaining abilities in a structured manner.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset used was collected on November 18th, 2023, so actual prices may differ over time, potentially biasing the model's understanding of product prices.

data.annotation: Data collected included product name, description, features, pricing history, and images.

methodology.calculation: Normalized Profits are calculated using the formulas defined for buyer and seller profits based on budgets and costs involved in bargaining sessions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher SNP indicates better bargaining ability.
methodology.baseline_results: Results from various LLMs such as GPT-4, ChatGPT, and multiple open-source models were compared.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated using multiple runs across LLMs to ensure reliability.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset is focused solely on products from Amazon and does not include a demographic breakdown.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset used does not contain personal information or offensive content.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data collected from publicly available resources for research purposes under standard fair use.
